rename.from: [FR] mlflow fc working for s3 artifact-store
rename.to: [FR] mlflow gc working for s3 artifact-store

body:
> @sklingel Thanks for filing this FR. Seems like a reasonable "good-first-issue" to tackle. Yes, it'll help `mlflow gc` for removing growing artifacts in S3 if they are stored there. There was an issue raised in the [slack about this](https://mlflow-users.slack.com/archives/CBFQ95Y2G/p1609924137498800).
> 
> Yes, you'll have to add a test in the [test_s3_artifact_repo.py](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/store/artifact/test_s3_artifact_repo.py), which checks to see if the uploaded files are deleted. Look at the https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/store/artifact/test_s3_artifact_repo.py#L129 as an example.
> 
> cc: @harupy @dbczumar any advice on writing the delete_artifact_tests?

Re: testing - https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/store/artifact/test_s3_artifact_repo.py leverages a mock S3 bucket constructed using the `moto` library; this should enable the PR author to assert that deleted files are no longer present in the mock bucket using the same `boto3` client calls that would be used against a real bucket.

Thanks. 
I started working on the test, after some intial setup issue, I found that you have to set
```
export AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=us-east-1
```
It seems that it needs to be set for this specific region (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49665155/boto3-aws-s3-bucket-creation-error).

Shouldn't that be added to: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/helper_functions.py#L252?

> Thanks.
> I started working on the test, after some intial setup issue, I found that you have to set
> 
> ```
> export AWS_DEFAULT_REGION=us-east-1
> ```
> 
> It seems that it needs to be set for this specific region (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/49665155/boto3-aws-s3-bucket-creation-error).
> 
> Shouldn't that be added to: https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/helper_functions.py#L252?

@sklingel Good question! The fact that existing tests pass without this configuration seems to indicate that this environment variable may not be entirely necessary. Is there something different about the test case you're adding that results in this behavior?
@dbczumar all the test in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/store/artifact/test_s3_artifact_repo.py are **not** passing locally for me, without this environment variable set.
What is the approach for the PR? I create a branch and link the issue in the PR?

> @dbczumar all the test in https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/tests/store/artifact/test_s3_artifact_repo.py are **not** passing locally for me, without this environment variable set.

Are you using the version of `moto` used by the MLflow test environment? https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/70f28c11f4687ebc089ee79cb920d813cb26e6ca/dev/small-requirements.txt#L10

> What is the approach for the PR? I create a branch and link the issue in the PR?

Yep! That would be great - I'll give it a review when you're ready!

> Are you using the version of moto used by the MLflow test environment?

Yes I'm using moto==1.3.16

I just created the PR. Happy to see your feedback

thanks, @dbczumar for the quick feedback and @sklingel for filling the PR.
As always, we appreciate community contributions! I assigned the PR review to @dbczumar
